news.title: Despite War and Strife, Ischemic Heart Disease Leads Deaths in ‘Arab Spring’
news.summary: Ischemic heart disease is the leading cause of death in the eastern Mediterranean region, a part of the world besieged by political and economic tumult, including the Arab uprisings, a new analysis shows.

news.title: Violence has taken years off of life expectancy in Syria
news.summary: LONDON (AP) — The ongoing violence in Syria has taken years off of people's life expectancy, according to a new analysis published in the journal Lancet on Wednesday.

news.title: The Lancet Global Health: Arab uprising has had long-term effect on health, lowering life expectancy in several countries
news.summary: War in Syria had erased 6 years off male life expectancy by 2013 Syria falling behind countries in Sub-Saharan Africa in reducing child mortality Conflicts threaten to jeopardise health gains over past two decades and will have impact on the region…

news.title: Life Expectancy In Syria Has Taken a Major Hit
news.summary: A man injured in a Saudi-led airstrike lies on a hospital bed in Sanaa, Yemen. It wasn't that long ago that Syrians were enjoying a steady increase in life expectancy—about a three-month bump every single year for more than two decades.
